intro: Campanula glomerata subsp. glomerata, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It features upright stems that bear clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers, which bloom in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and often covered in fine white down. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This species is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
